```{python}
#| echo: false
#|
# import altair with an abbreviated alias
import altair as alt

# Define a custom theme function
import yaml
import tempfile
import os
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from IPython.display import display, Markdown
import functools

def my_theme(brand_yml):
    brand = yaml.safe_load(open(brand_yml).read())
    fg = brand["color"]["foreground"]
    bg = brand["color"]["background"]
    return {
        'config': {
            'view': {'stroke': 'transparent'},
            'axis': {
                'domainColor': fg,
                'labelColor': fg,
                'titleColor': fg,
            },
            'legend': {
                'labelColor': fg,
                'titleColor': fg,
            },
            'background': bg,  # Background color
        }
    }

united_theme = functools.partial(my_theme, 'united-brand.yml')
slate_theme = functools.partial(my_theme, 'slate-brand.yml')

# Register the custom theme and enable it
alt.renderers.enable('svg')
alt.themes.register('united_theme', united_theme)
alt.themes.register('slate_theme', slate_theme)


# load a sample dataset as a pandas DataFrame
from vega_datasets import data
cars = data.cars()

display(Markdown('[]{.quarto-light-marker}'))
alt.themes.enable('united_theme')

# make the chart
display(alt.Chart(cars).mark_point().encode(
    x='Horsepower',
    y='Miles_per_Gallon',
    color='Origin',
).interactive())


display(Markdown('[]{.quarto-dark-marker}'))
alt.themes.enable('slate_theme')

# make the chart
display(alt.Chart(cars).mark_point().encode(
    x='Horsepower',
    y='Miles_per_Gallon',
    color='Origin',
).interactive())
```
